Yo, bro, I tried makin’ rendang at home yesterday—took 3 hours but was SO worth it! Them spices hit different, especially with hot rice. You like spicy rendang? Ever tried makin’ it yourself?
Found this dope sate klatak at the night market—juicy meat, marinade on point! They say it’s a Jogja thing. You ever had unique satay in your area? Spill the tea!
I’m explorin’ artisan teas, bro—just tried sencha green tea, smell was fire! You rock with tea or coffee more? Any local drink recs?
Hit up this Betawi spot yesterday, their sop iga had me forgettin’ my diet! Broth was rich, meat melted in my mouth. What’s your go-to traditional spot? Take me with you!
Tried makin’ sweet martabak at home—chocolate n’ cheese topping, but it came out a lil dense, lol! Any tips for fluffy dough? You team sweet or savory martabak?
New café near my job got crème brûlée—texture was smooth as butter! What’s your fave dessert, bro? Ever tried somethin’ wild?
Just had Jakarta-style nasi uduk—full spread with tempe orek n’ fried chicken! What’s your top traditional rice dish? Tell me!
I’m deep in this fermentation wave, bro—made my own kimchi, spice level: lethal! You ever tried fermented foods? How they taste?
Ate at this Padang spot yesterday—their gulai otak was creamy, had me goin’ back for more! What’s your Padang fave? Or you got a go-to spot?
